description: From Ancient Greek φίμωσις (phímōsis, “muzzling; contraction of the prepuce”), from φῑμόω (phīmóō, “to muzzle”) +‎ -σις (-sis, nominal suffix).

entries.meaning: (medicine) A contraction of the foreskin (either as a stage of development or a pathological condition), which prevents it from being retracted.
examples: ’Twill end in a phimosis, replied Dr. Slop.
